oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eradication of Johne's Disease from a Heavily Infected Herd in 12 Months
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Collins, M. T.
Manning, E. J. B.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: paratuberculosis
husbandry changes
testing program
record keeping
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The goal of the project was to demonstrate that it is FEASIBLE to eradicate paratuberculosis, and that it can be done fairly quickly. The project was not intended to evaluate the most cost-effective strategy for Johne's eradication. Conscientious implementation of husbandry changes to limit spread of M. paratuberculosis infection coupled with accurate record keeping, and a testing program to identify the infected cows for culling should lead to control and eventual elimination of paratuberculosis from most dairy herds.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 241-244
